description.raw:
On homebrew, the ignition-math4 formula now uses ignition-cmake, which defines some of the same macros as are used in other ignition packages. This [breaks the build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/BuildCopFail/job/ignition_msgs-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/55, as in [ign-common issue 25](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/issues/25/cmake-configuration-error-on-homebrew). There is a quick hack that involves re-loading the Utils.cmake file after all the find_package calls, as was done in the following PR:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/78

I also copied the appveyor scripts without ign-cmake from pull request #40.

The Ubuntu build also requires the following release-tools pull request:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/461/use-ignition-math4-for-ignition-msgs-on/diff

title.raw: Hack to reload macros (similar to ign-common fix)
